name: SpringHill Suites Atlanta Airport Gateway

reviews.text: If you are looking for a place to spend the night before an early morning flight out of Atlanta’s airport… This is the place. I have a home in Auburn Alabama, which is 1.5 hours and a time zone away from the airport, so this is crucial for me. A 6 minute ride to/from the Airport terminal on the new SkyTrain , the Springhill Suites by Marriott offers a quality night rest at a reasonable price. The train arrives every 2-3 minutes so waiting for hotel shuttle buses is no longer an issue. One note: if coming from the airport remember to get off the train at the intermediate stop at the convention center. The hotel is new (quiet), has spacious well-appointed (contemporary style) rooms, coffee makers, microwave and refrigerator. Best of all is the free Internet and a free hot breakfast. I had a King suite. The room had a semi-separate living / bedroom area. In addition, there were two closed bath areas; one with the toilet and small sink and the other with a large walk-in shower and sink area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The fitness center was well equipped. The only down side was that the hotel does not have a restaurant or bar and there were none within the immediate area.
reviews.title: Place to stay before early morning flight

reviews.text: Wow!! If you're staying at Atlanta Airport, you have to check this place out. Literally 5 minutes from baggage claim to hotel room via the new Skytrain (runs very often, not like the 30 minute wait if you just miss the Hilton bus!) that goes to the new rental car center and you're at this brand new Marriott Springhill Suites hotel. I've been traveling through Atlanta for years and am sick of those hotel buses!
reviews.title: MOST CONVENIENT HOTEL @ ATL - NO SHUTTLE BUS...just take the SKYTRAIN!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I noticed the hotel in the morning when I went to pick up my rental car on the new Skytrain (very convenient by the way). Due to all this cold weather, my evening flight was cancelled and I went straight over there and grabbed a room for the night ($139). Free breakfast, free internet, and a great lobby where you can hang out and get a beer + meal. The rooms are huge and look like they could fit a family (pull-out sofa in a living room type area). 42" Plasma screen, comfortable bed, and great shower - what more do you need? One very cool thing is the sound of SILENCE in the rooms! The sound insulation must be super-sized because I didn't hear any planes at all (another first for an airport hotel!).
reviews.title: Great new hotel, can think of little to improve it

reviews.text: If I had planned on staying overnight at the Hilton or somewhere, I would have kept the rental car for another night (+$50 at least) and there's no need to do that here. I would have dropped off the car, jumped on the Skytrain to the Springhill and spent $20 on beer/wine congratulating myself on saving money!
reviews.title: Will stay here again - great location!

aka: Springhill Suites Atlanta Airport Gateway Hotel
description: Our hotel is conveniently connected to Hartsfield - Jackson Atlanta International Airport via Skytrain, making us an ideal choice for visitors to the city. Guests will appreciate our location near many of the area's top businesses as well as our spacious suites and complimentary breakfast and internet access.
